creator: gregor.heine@iona.com
text:
In order to extend (subclass) the Java Task, it would be really helpful if it's
API were brought more in sync with the API of ExecTask. Specifically the
following changes:

- Make class member "cmdl" protected instead of private.
- Allow custom StreamHandlers via an overridable (protected) createHandler()
method that is called in fork(String[]) instead of directly calling
redirector.createHandler(). 
- Make the class member "redirector" protected so it can be subclassed (this is
needed in ExecTask as well).

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text:
There is a new <redirector> type in CVS HEAD that represents the existing 
Redirector.  <exec>, <apply>, and <java> have been adapted to use this type.  
It may provide some or all of what you're looking for.

-Matt

creator: gregor.heine@iona.com
text:
Thanks, that solves the second and third point above. Good work!

Would it be possible also to change the access modifier of member
CommandlineJava cmdl from private to protected, as it is in
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.ExecTask? That would allow subclasses, e.g. to
access the full commandline etc.

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text:
I don't see anything wrong with making the Commandline protected, personally, 
although at the same time I can't right-off imagine a situation that would 
necessitate it, either...
what would you want to do with cmdl that you can't do with the current API?
creator: bodewig@apache.org
gregor.heine@iona.com
text:
For logging purposes, I require the full commandline of the executed java
process, as returned by Commandline.getCommandline().
